content:
Meeting in ~25 minutes.

I want to bring up (but likely not discuss in too much detail unless others want to) the charter work email I sent out (thanks Pietro for leaving some comments). In the next 25 minutes I'm going to try to take a look at some blog post fixes...

I did have one question about the email, it‚Äôs mainly around the phrasing.

There's an initial list of questions for us to answer:

  • What is your contribution to the Rust project?

Is the you in ‚Äúyour‚Äù here, what does us the team contribute, or us as individuals? I‚Äôm assuming it‚Äôs the former.

Yes, that's intended to refer to the team. That said, one of the key aspects is identifying just what the team does - and sometimes, the line between "my" contributions as an individual, rather than what I do with a release hat on, can be fuzzy, so if you feel like there's something maybe relevant, definitely bring it up!
@T-release meeting!
(I have to do a school run this morning, so my attendance will be spotty)
alright, let's get started
@DPC anything on triage?
not much to report, reports look fine
sounds good
alright, first off the charter work -- any questions or thoughts we should discuss sync?
(I'm wondering if we should first discuss next week's release and then leave the rest of the time for charter)
hmm
well it seems like there's not much on charter for now, so no problem on my side
I think a sync discussion over a hackmd makes sense. I don‚Äôt know others schedules though.
did you have something in particular to bring up?
so, I think I'm the one running this release, and I already opened the PR for friday's version bump
I haven't checked, and I planned to do it later, but does anyone have a clear overview of where we're at for beta backports and unfixed regressions?
my sense was pretty good but I've been really busy so haven't concretely looked
ok, I'll probably do in a thread somewhere a recap of what the status is later today or early tomorrow
and then if there's something critical I'll ping t-release
sounds good, I guess there's probably a few backports and such necessary, but I can also invest some time tonight/tomorrow
that's all from me

XAMPPRocky said:

I think a sync discussion over a hackmd makes sense. I don‚Äôt know others schedules though.

alright, back to this -- I guess this makes sense to me, maybe we can try and schedule something next week or so - I can send around a doodle?
hmm
I'm wondering a bit, could we do that after release week?
maybe we can also try to generate some topics for discussion (e.g., over email or in the google doc, whatever) for such a meeting - I'm not quite clear
yeah I think we can, though it does push things a bit -- sort of depends on what @XAMPPRocky you're hoping to discuss :)
(I'd love to discuss the first comment of mine, I agree with your concerns mark and we should probably formulate that differently)
@simulacrum well I think we‚Äôd start with answering the questions in the email as a group, and build our charter from that.
hm, I guess, to be clear - are you not happy with the proposed ones in the google doc?
to be clear, at this stage in the process, the goal isn't to have a full charter
just to answer these questions
the actual charter will come later
Oops I haven‚Äôt read that üòÖ
Only saw the text.
Ah! OK
So I‚Äôll get back to you on that üôÇ
well, I'll send out a doodle for, uh, week after release week
and we can maybe discuss some async over email or so before then
There's a backport coming to disable inline-asm stack probes, I think
yeah I'll probably leave a bunch of other comments in a bit

cuviper said:

There's a backport coming to disable inline-asm stack probes, I think

ok I'll check-in on that later
sounds great. Alright - @triagebot end-meeting ?

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
And did the c unwind one land yet?

cuviper said:

And did the c unwind one land yet?

not sure - I saw it failed last night? Maybe landed since then. Some checking to do for sure.
@cuviper to merge or revert?
I think revert again
did I miss the never type being bundled along the c unwind stabilization?
At least or patterns is in 1.53 :smile:

Pietro Albini said:

did I miss the never type being bundled along the c unwind stabilization?

hey we're actually making good progress there :)
anyway, thanks all!
@T-release one thing I didn't mention - https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/822 could use another review and some suggestions on how to structure it
